decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. Utilizing a mix of powerful creatures such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage and resilience. The inclusion of hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress help to dismantle your opponent's strategy before they even have a chance to execute it.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly and efficiently equipping creatures with powerful equipment to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Sigarda's Aid and Colossus Hammer to equip creatures like Cloud, Midgar Mercenary and Kemba, Kha Enduring with powerful equipment like Shadowspear. By quickly establishing a board presence and equipping creatures with powerful artifacts, the deck can overwhelm opponents and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving cards like Burning Anger, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Colossification, and Storm Herald to quickly overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures. The deck includes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Thrilling Discovery to search for the necessary pieces, while cards like Joshua, Phoenix's Dominant and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded provide additional support. The deck also includes some removal and ramp options to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The aim is to set up the combo and finish the game decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and put pressure on the opponent with low-cost spells and early creatures while maintaining card advantage through card draw and recursion. The deck focuses on efficiently dealing damage to the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells and protecting its creatures. Additionally, the mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent access to the necessary colors of mana to cast spells and activate abilities.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck utilizes card draw and cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and swing in for quick damage. Picklock Prankster helps to disrupt the opponent's plans while also providing another way to bring back the Phoenix. The deck's mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency in casting spells and bringing back the Phoenix as quickly as possible. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and close out the game before they can stabilize.
